headline: Labour Vows Not to Raise Income Tax
summary: Gordon Brown's Labour Party set out a manifesto pitched to the center, promising not to raise income taxes and pledging broad reforms of the public sector if it wins the U.K. election.

headline: AIG Discloses Pay and Performance Details
summary: AIG detailed compensation and performance metrics for its executives in a filing with the SEC.

summary: A group of bondholders aligned with real-estate magnate Donald Trump won a victory over financier Carl Icahn in a bid to control three casinos in Atlantic City that bear Mr. Trump's name.

headline: LCD TV Makers Ramp Up
summary: Sharp will begin sales of liquid crystal televisions that can show three-dimensional images before this summer, and Panasonic said it was pushing forward the start of a new LCD panel factory in western Japan by three months.

headline: Two Paths to Software Upgrade
summary: JetBlue and WestJet switched to the same reservations systems. One transition was bumpier than the other and a reminder of how the implementation of new technology can be just as crucial as the technology itself.

headline: Galleon Insider Case Widens
summary: Federal prosecutors are looking into alleged improper trading involving more than a dozen companies not previously disclosed in an insider-trading probe that has ensnared several hedge-fund executives, including Galleon Group founder Raj Rajaratnam.

summary: Activision saw two creators of its blockbuster "Call of Duty: Modern Warfare" franchise set up their own development studio under a deal with arch-rival Electronic Arts.

summary: Disputes over Afghanistan, antiterror policies and diplomacy have soured the relationship.

summary: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. said Tuesday its chairman for Southeast Asian operations, David Ryan, will also now act as the co-head of investment banking for the Asia ex-Japan region.

headline: China's Tencent to Invest in DST
summary: China's Tencent Holdings is purchasing a 10% stake in Digital Sky Technologies, a Russian investment firm that holds a stake in Facebook Inc.

summary: Deutsche Bank Australia has named Adam Boyton as chief economist.

summary: National carrier Air India appointed Gustav Baldauf as its first chief operating officer, and as the first expatriate in its management.

summary: GLG Partners, D.E. Shaw & Co. and the Canadian Pension Plan are among the investors opening or expanding their Asian offices in recent months.

summary: The Singh family, founders of Fortis Healthcare and Religare Enterprises, will focus on growing their healthcare business, and have put in place a key management team to handle the financial services business.

summary: Peabody Energy and state-owned Coal India are discussing possible cooperative ventures as part of broad-ranging, preliminary talks.

summary: Javelin said it planned to scrap its $81 million takeover deal with rival drug developer Myriad Pharmaceuticals after getting a $141 million offer from Hospira.

summary: Geely Auto's net profit rose 35% after it nearly doubled its stakes in five car-making joint ventures

headline: GM Expects Strong China Growth
summary: General Motors expects to boost its annual sales in China to more than three million vehicles in 2015. The U.S. auto maker's sales in China rose 67% last year to 1.83 million vehicles.

summary: The Dow closed above 11000 for the first time since late-September 2008, helped by a 1.3% gain in component Alcoa.

summary: Devon Energy agreed to sell its assets in the shallow waters of the Gulf of Mexico to Apache for $1.05 billion, a deal that reinforces Apache's dominant position in the Outer Continental Shelf.

headline: A New Home for Nefertiti
summary: The Neues Museum (New Museum) in Berlin, originally designed by Friedrich August Stüler and built between 1841 and 1859, recently reopened after a large reconstruction project. The museum, which suffered significant damage from World War II bombing, is home to an impressive Egyptian art collection, including the famous Bust of Nefertiti. Here's a look.

summary: Ukraine will get rid of its stockpile of highly enriched uranium by 2012, the White House said Monday, the first breakthrough to emerge from the summit of nearly 50 world leaders Barack Obama is hosting.

summary: Some lenders attacked Tribune's proposed settlement of legal trouble stemming from the LBO deal that saddled the publisher with debt, saying they wouldn't "pay for the alleged sins of others."

summary: A strong rise in retail sales points to a stronger economy. But a slower rise in house prices shows that the pent-up supply of houses could outstrip firmer demand.

summary: Crude settled lower for the fourth consecutive trading day, as concern over high supply levels outweighed news of additional financial support for Greece and signs of strong oil demand from China.
